title: Britain's 'most capable PM'? Starmer opens up record 13-point lead over Sunak in new Ipsos poll
description: Sir Keir Starmer has opened up a record 13-point lead over Rishi Sunak in terms of who Britons think is the “most capable Prime Minister ”, according to a new poll.

title: I was wrong about the House of Lords – good peers are holding the Government to account
description: In 2022, Sir Simon Jenkins opined scathingly in a Guardian column about the club of the great, the good and not good at all: “Not one living prime minister has deigned to darken its door. They know too much of its deals, kickbacks and cronyism to be reminded of them round every corner.

title: 70% of housebuilders want Labour to win General Election, says Knight Frank
description: The Knight Frank Land Index & Housebuilder Survey of English housebuilders shows 70% favour Labour government plans for reform.

title: Japan PM vows to do 'everything possible' to boost household income

title: Wales has been brave enough to completely rethink the hated council tax. Take note, England
description: The Senedd’s plan to shift the burden of this levy away from those on lower incomes shows how real levelling up can work, says the Guardian columnist Polly Toynbee

title: Propertymark urges government to hold landlord forums
description: Local authorities need to hold landlord forums to allow them to properly engage with the Renters Reform Bill passing through parliament, Propertymark has argued. The estate agency trade group found that 52% of local authorities in England have not had a ...

title: You've heard of GCSEs, so what are VCSEs?
description: Qualifications Wales said it hoped VCSEs would become as recognised a brand as GCSE and “valued in the same way”. VCSEs will be a new brand of vocational qualifications. These are more practical and tend to be geared at certain jobs or careers. They are a different to general qualifications like GCSEs which are usually awarded in academic subjects.

title: Rail reform and liberalisation: Where are we?
description: After a century without coherent rail policy in SA, the White Paper on National Rail Policy was adopted by the Cabinet in March 2022.

title: Windsor Framework: ‘Fundamental reform’ needed to solve problems says economist Esmond Birnie
description: A leading economist says that problems affecting the Northern Ireland economy can only be dealt with by fundamental reforms of the Windsor Framework.

title: NDC prefers election date change to take effect from 2028
description: The opposition National Democratic Congress NDC has supported the change in the day for national elections but wants the reform to begin in 2028.

title: Rishi Sunak handed blueprint for shock election win with 'radical offer' on immigration
description: A leading academic said the PM could "pull off one of the biggest shocks" in the history of general elections by promising a referendum on reducing immigration.

title: Castletown property rates to rise 9% from April
description: Residents in Castletown are facing an above-inflation rate rise from April, the local authority has confirmed. Ratepayers face a hike of 9% in their domestic rates and 8.9% in the refuse rate. That equates to an average town rate rise of £38.

title: Illinois appeals courts see ‘dramatic increase’ in cases following elimination of cash bail

title: Extra funding announced for crucial council services in Surrey but 'difficult decisions' remain
description: It comes amid a backdrop of councils facing difficult financial times, with Woking declaring itself effectively bankrupt, Runnymede being served a Best Value Notice, and Surrey County Council admitting it would need to make serious cuts to protect services and increase tax by the maximum allowable in order to have a legal budget.

title: Welfare reforms 'a disgrace' says cleric
description: ONE of Britain's most senior Catholic figures has criticised the Government's welfare reform programme as a "disgrace" that is driving people to destitution. In one of the most strongly worded attacks yet by a senior church figure, Vincent Nichols ...

title: Unite bosses back Labour plans to reform unions link
description: Leaders of Unite have backed plans to reform the historic link between Labour and the unions. The executive of Unite held a special meeting to discuss a paper drawn up for Labour leader Ed Miliband by Lord Collins, a former union and party official.
